ygData.subject: Re: Breaking a "Root" spell cast on you!
ygData.msgSnippet: I came to the same conclusion. I have /bugged the heck out of Verrant but never get a reply or answer so I will keep using it when my Health is in immenent
ygData.messageBody:
I came to the same conclusion. I have /bugged the heck out of Verrant but
never get a reply or answer so I will keep using it when my Health is in
immenent trouble.


Koden
Bard of The League of Swords
----- Original Message -----
From: John Robertson <johnr@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Monday, May 03, 1999 7:09 AM
Subject: [eqbards] Re: Breaking a "Root" spell cast on you!


> From: "John Robertson" <johnr@...>
>
>
>
> "Mott, Mike J." wrote:
>
> > From: "Mott, Mike J." <MIKE.J.MOTT@...>
> >
> > Hail Fellow Singers!
> >
> > Adventuring in my favored zone of the West Commonlands near Freeport, I
> > stumbled upon an interesting fact which has now saved my life numerous
times
> > - the Accelerando OVERCOMES a GhoulRoot spell!
>
> The accelerando overcomes all root spells, no matter the source. It's a
bug.
> It actually "overcomes" spirit of the wolf and spirit of cheetah too. It
> probably overcomes other things that slow you down, like clinging darkness
too.
>
> Basically, speed altering effects in EQ seem to only remember the most
recent
> change, so if you have spirit of the wolf on you, then sing the
accelerando,
> then stop, you'll be moving at regular speed. And so on, and so on...
>
> I have /bugged this in many forms. Using it could be considered an
exploit, but
> I do so when the alternative is death. :)
>
> Jyzan
>
>
